In the biginning of the 14th century, the King D. Afonso IV (“The Brave” as he was known) ordered that should be built a wall around the city in order to protect it strategically, but he died, in 1357, without seeing is masterpiece completed. It was only finished in 1370. 
The name “Muralhas Fernandinas” comes from name of the first king to have Porto as a protected and secure city within the walls - D. Fernando - “The handsome”.
